div.bibl: Zgoda, Vol. XIX, No. 29, July 19, 1900ZELINSKI'S CHOIR

body.p: Under the above name a new choir was organized for men, so far there are twenty-five members and we feel sure that in a short time the membership will be doubled. The admission fee is fifty cents, with a monthly fee of twenty-five cents until January 1, 1901, after which time the monthly rate will be forty cents.
Lessons and classes are held every Wednesday in Mr. Zembal's hall, located at 41 Wells street.
The officers of this choir are: W. Jelen, president; J. Sobota, vice-president; J.Homplewicz, recording secretary; W. Kaniowski, financial secretary; J. Jarosz, cashier; J. Jelen, librarian.
The director of this choir is Mr. J. J. Novicki, who is also general director of the United Polish Singers.
